required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Health in Children With Down Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Measures of Pulmonary Health in Children With Down Syndrome

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to learn more about tests that can assess lung health in children with Down syndrome.

primary_outcome.description: Airway resistance (R5) measured using forced oscillation technique at 5 Hertz
Airway reactance (X5) measured using forced oscillation technique at 5 Hertz

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total airway resistance after albuterol
secondary_outcome.description: Airway resistance (R5) measured using forced oscillation technique at 5 Hertz before and after administration of albuterol

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in airway reactance after albuterol
secondary_outcome.description: Airway reactance (X5) measured using forced oscillation technique at 5 Hertz before and after administration of albuterol

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-related quality of life, as measured by the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: The Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) assesses four domains of quality of life. Results are converted to a score from 0-100, where low numbers are low quality of life and higher numbers is better quality of life.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children with Down syndrome and aspiration
arm_group.description: Outcomes will be compared between two groups although no intervention is submitted, this is an observational study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children with Down syndrome without aspiration
arm_group.description: Outcomes will be compared between two groups although no intervention is submitted, this is an observational study.

study_pop.textblock: Children aged 3-18 years (inclusive) with a diagnosis of Down syndrome who have had a swallow study in the previous 2 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 3 to 18 years, inclusive, at time of consent
- Diagnosis of Down syndrome/trisomy 21 or mosaicism
- Able to walk
- Had a swallow study (video fluoroscopic swallow study or fiberoptic endoscopic evaluation of swallowing) performed within 2 years of consent date
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating
- Nonambulatory
- Have a tracheostomy or other known severe glottic or subglottic obstruction that would significantly affect the results of testing
- Have a significant acute respiratory illness, defined as treatment with steroids, antibiotics, or an increase in supplemental oxygen
- have a medical illness that would a)increase the risk the participate would incur by participating in the study, b) interfere with the outcomes of the study, or c) interfere with the performance of study participants
- Have a severe behavioral problem that would interfere with the performance of study procedures
